intro: Thalictrum stipitatum, commonly known as the slender meadow-rue, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Thalictrum stipitatum is often found in meadows, stream banks, and shaded forest areas.
